definition: A sudden and unauthorized entry into a place, typically with the intention of committing a crime or theft. It is commonly used to refer to the act of breaking into a building or premises without permission or legal authority.

examples.german: Der Einbruch in das Haus war sehr gewalttätig.
examples.english: The break-in into the house was very violent.

examples.german: Die Einbrüche in der Nachbarschaft haben zugenommen.
examples.english: The burglaries in the neighborhood have increased.

examples.german: Der Einbruch der Dunkelheit machte die Suche schwierig.
examples.english: The onset of darkness made the search difficult.

examples.german: Die Einbruchquote ist in den letzten Jahren gesunken.
examples.english: The burglary rate has decreased in recent years.

examples.german: Die Polizei konnte den Einbruch verhindern.
examples.english: The police were able to prevent the break-in.
